name: Mindful Self-Compassion
description: Mindful Self-Compassion: Learn how to be kinder to yourself through mindful self-compassion meditations and information.

name: Pallouse Mindfulness
description: Pallouse Mindfulness: extensive free resources for Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction.

name: Student Wellness Centre, McMaster University
description: Student Wellness Centre, McMaster University: includes guided mindfulness and relaxation exercises and information on the theoretical foundations of mindfulness.

name: Your Health Audio and Video Recordings, Simon Fraser University
description: Your Health Audio and Video Recordings, Simon Fraser University: learn about and practice various mindfulness and relaxation exercises through guided audio and video recordings.

name: Mental Health Meter, Canadian Mental Health Association
description: Mental Health Meter, Canadian Mental Health Association: can help you identify your unique strength and areas for improving your mental fitness. This is not meant to serve as a diagnostic tool – it may help identify things that need to be brought to the attention of a mental health professional.

name: e-Mental Health
description: e-Mental Health: provides free, anonymous, and clinically-informed questionnaires to help identify mental health concerns that require help from a health professional.

name: Check Up from the Neck Up, Mood Disorders Association of Ontario
description: Check Up from the Neck Up, Mood Disorders Association of Ontario: a simple, online, private mental health quiz that can help identify concerns that you need to seek help from a mental health professional.

name: Getting a good night's sleep
description: Getting a good night's sleep: an interactive module outlining some best practices for sleep behaviours.

name: Apple iOS
description: Apple iOS

name: Centre for Clinical Interventions (CCI)
description: Centre for Clinical Interventions (CCI): provides modules you can work through to help you understand and manage anxiety and depression.

name: More Feet on the Ground
description: More Feet on the Ground: an educational website on how to recognize, respond, and refer students experiencing mental health concerns. The Council of Ontario Universities (COU) has partnered with Brock University and the Ontario government to develop this website.

name: Mindsight
description: Mindsight: an interactive and informative resource about mental health developed by Dr. Wendy Stanyon (Ontario Tech University Faculty of Health Sciences).

name: Coping with Exams and Exam Anxiety
description: Coping with Exams and Exam Anxiety: learn some guidelines to alleviate some of the stress and fear associated with exams.

name: Dealing with Exam Anxiety.
description: Dealing with Exam Anxiety.

name: Techniques to De-Stress.
description: Techniques to De-Stress.

name: BounceBack
description: BounceBack: BounceBack is a free skill-building website that allows individuals to manage their symptoms of anxiety and depression.

name: Insight Timer
description: Insight Timer: Thousands of free meditations to help manage stress, reduce anxiety, improve sleep and more.

name: Mindbeacon
description: Mindbeacon: free Cognitive Behavioural Therapy available to residents of Ontario.

name: ‘Controlling Anger Before it Controls You’, American Psychological Association
description: ‘Controlling Anger Before it Controls You’, American Psychological Association: defining anger and introduces strategies to help control anger.

name: What
description: What BETTER Feels Like, Mood Disorders Society of Canada: gain insight into depression and what recovery looks like through interview videos of individuals who have lived experience.

name: Books and resources by Dr. Alan Wolfelt
description: Books and resources by Dr. Alan Wolfelt: to help people work through grief and mourning and how to support it.

name: Books and Resources by
description: Books and Resources by Dr. Tara Brach: learn about bringing mindfulness and spiritual practices to your life.

name: Guided Mindfulness Meditations, UCLA.
description: Guided Mindfulness Meditations, UCLA.

name: #UTRAIN: Stay active while staying at home!
location: Providers: UTM, UTSG | Care Category: Self-Guided Activities
description: Fitness & Performance is teaming up with Hart House and the University of Toronto Mississauga to bring you the University of Toronto Virtual Fitness Studio.

name: Access CAMH
location: Provider: Community | Care Category: Information & Education
description: Providing centralized information, intake and scheduling for most of the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) services, Access CAMH makes it easy for patients, families, friends and healthcare professionals to find the help and services they need with a single phone call.

name: Across Boundaries
location: Provider: Community | Care Categories: One-On-One Sessions, Group Programs
description: Providing equitable, holistic mental health and addiction services for racialized communities.

name: Arrive UTSC
location: Provider: UTSC | Care Category: Group Programs
description: Join the ArriveUTSC program and learn how to thrive both personally and academically by: Better understanding the connections between academic success and personal well-beingBuilding motivation, optimism, and resilienceImproving learning strategy essentials like time management and effective studyingDeveloping a sense of belonging on campus ArriveUTSC is a holistic 7-week group-based program. To be eligible for this program, you must be a UTSC student who: started in 2019 or beforeis getting low gradesis on academic probationor is on academic suspension If this is you, then we invite you to sign-up to attend this mini-course. This may be the right time to pause, re-evaluate and pick up some tools to help you move forward in a meaningful way!

name: Better Coping Skills
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Categories: Self-Guided Activities, Organized Workshops
description: This four-part synchronous workshop series can help you navigate the demands of university life. You can also learn better coping skills any time through the online, self-directed version of the workshop.

name: BounceBack
location: Provider: Community | Care Categories: One-On-One Sessions, Guided Learning, Information & Education, Self-Guided Activities
description: BounceBack is a free, guided self-help program that's effective in helping people aged 15 and up who are experiencing mild-to-moderate anxiety or depression, or may be feeling low, stressed, worried, irritable or angry. Participants receive telephone coaching, skill-building workbooks and online videos to help them overcome these symptoms and gain new skills to regain positive mental health. To receive telephone coaching support, clients must either be referred by their primary care provider (family doctor, nurse practitioner) or psychiatrist, or they may self-refer as long as they're connected with a primary care provider. For those who are not quite ready for coaching, our online videos can provide helpful tips.

name: Building Positive Mental Health
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: Organized Workshops
description: Building Positive Mental Health workshops teach you various strategies to promote positive mental health during the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH)
location: Providers: Community, Partner | Care Categories: One-On-One Sessions, Group Programs
description: The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is providing a 10-week Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) group through their Improving Access to Structured Psychotherapy (IASP) program for students experiencing mild to moderate symptoms of depression and anxiety. Referral from HCC clinician required.

name: Community of Champions
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: Information & Education
description: Community of Champions is a campus recognition program. Individuals, groups and/or initiatives who or that make an important contribution to building a healthier and more supportive learning environment on campus are acknowledged and celebrated.

name: Fitness and Lifestyle Consultation
location: Provider: UTSC | Care Category: Specialist Care
description: Virtual appointment booked through Dept of Athletics and Recreation with a certified Trainer/Nutritionist regarding exercise and healthy concepts.

name: Fitness and Recreation
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Category: Self-Guided Activities
description: U of T offers an extensive choice of fitness and recreational activities across all three campuses, many of which can be done virtually. Browse the selection and get active as part of your wellness journey.

name: Foodie Friday
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Information & Education
description: Get inspired to cook at home with the Health & Counselling Centre's dietitian, Kimberly Green! Featuring a unique recipe every Friday on our Instagram account (served up with some nutritional advice, tips and tricks).

name: Graduate Wellness Counselling
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: One-On-One Sessions
description: During the Fall 2020-2021 term, Graduate students can access counselling online. The Health and Wellness Centre on the St. George Campus continues to offer brief counselling services either by telephone or video conferencing tailored to the challenges presented by graduate-level university life. The focus of counselling is on identifying strengths, acquiring resiliency, and building coping skills.

name: Group Therapy
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Category: Group Programs
description: Join a group to gain support from fellow students and learn that you're not alone in what you're experiencing. Groups range from an evidence-based structured curriculum to interpersonal based programming. Learn new skills to enhance your university experience and improve your general health and well-being. Groups may address various topics such as anxiety, body image, low or depressed mood, self-compassion, sleep, stress management, and resilience.

name: Hart House UofTea Talks
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: Peer to Peer Support
description: This is your chance to hear the real "tea" at U of T. Tune in to our weekly Instagram Live sessions to ask the Hart House Student Ambassadors anything! Each week will be a little bit different, as we go live with different groups, students and spaces on campus.

name: Hart House Virtual Board Game Cafe
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: Self-Guided Activities
description: Board games are a great icebreaker that allow you to connect with others without that awkward small talk. Now, enjoy games and fun online! Grab a hot drink, your comfiest outfit, and join us virtually.

name: Health and dental plans for U of T students
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Categories: Crisis Support & Care Team Planning, Specialist Care, One-On-One Sessions, Guided Learning, Information & Education, Self-Guided Activities, Peer to Peer Support, Organized Workshops
description: Health and dental plan coverage for U of T students runs from September 1 to August 31 each year as provided by five student societies across the three U of T campuses. Additionally, the University Health Insurance Plan (UHIP) is a mandatory health insurance plan for all international and exchange students enrolled at U of T. Click the links below to find out about plan eligibility and the coverage provided by each student society and UHIP.

name: Hong Fook Mental Health Services
location: Provider: Community | Care Categories: Information & Education, Self-Guided Activities, Peer to Peer Support, Organized Workshops
description: Hong Fook provides a continuum of integrated primary care and mental health services, covering the spectrum from promoting wellness to managing illness in Asian communities

name: Identify, Assist, Refer Online Training
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Categories: Crisis Support & Care Team Planning, Self-Guided Activities
description: Identify, Assist, Refer (IAR) online training prepares students, faculty, and staff with skills and information to support students experiencing different types of challenges that impact mental health.

name: Live Cooking Classes
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Organized Workshops
description: Join the Health & Counselling Centre's dietitian, Kimberly Green, for a live cooking tutorial on Instagram Live, based on one of her signature, healthy and budget-friendly recipes.

name: Mental Health and Wellness Workshops
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Categories: Group Programs, Organized Workshops
description: These are workshops facilitated by health care professionals and health promotion staff on various topics and themes that include mindfulness, sleep, coping with anxiety, skill-building, overall wellness and more.

name: Mindful Moments
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Categories: Guided Learning, Organized Workshops
description: Be more calm, confident and connected. Join weekly opportunities Mondays through Fridays to practice secular mindful meditation techniques that will increase your relaxation and focus.

name: Mindful Monday: Mindfulness Meditation
location: Provider: UTM | Care Categories: Guided Learning, Organized Workshops
description: Start your week by taking time to be in the present moment and align with your goals for the days ahead. Our weekly mindfulness meditation class is led by Health & Counselling Centre counselling staff and requires no experience to participate.

name: MoveU
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Category: Self-Guided Activities
description: MoveU is a tri-campus initiative at the University of Toronto with teams on all three campuses. At MoveU, our goal is to encourage physical activity and promote a healthy active lifestyle.

name: Peel Addiction Assessment Referral Centre (PAARC)
location: Providers: Community, Partner | Care Categories: Specialist Care, One-On-One Sessions
description: Counselling and consultation for students living with addictions or who are concerned about their substance use.

name: Peer-Led Wellness Workshops
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Categories: Information & Education, Group Programs, Peer to Peer Support, Organized Workshops
description: Our wellness student teams are dedicated undergraduate and graduate Work Study and volunteer students who provide peer health and wellness education workshops on various topics relevant to students to make healthier choices and informed decisions related to their overall wellbeing.

name: Stella’s Place
location: Provider: Community | Care Categories: One-On-One Sessions, Peer to Peer Support
description: Stella’s Place provides comprehensive mental health services for 16 to 29 year olds in a positive, peer engaging, non-residential community setting. They offer a full menu of choices including peer support, clinical, employment, wellness, studio and recovery programs to help young adults learn skills, find connection and be empowered to manage their own health.

name: Student-Led Wellness Programming
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Categories: Information & Education, Self-Guided Activities, Organized Workshops
description: The wellness student teams are dedicated undergraduate and graduate work-study and volunteer students who contribute to health promotion activities to foster a healthy campus. As a reliable resource for students, they provide peer health education programming such as displays, workshops, events, podcasts, and blogs that empowers other students to reach their health and wellness goals and make healthier choices that support academic success and personal resilience.

name: Suicide Prevention Training
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Category: Organized Workshops
description: There are a variety of trainings offered across U of T to support suicide prevention. LivingWorks START is a 90-minute e-learning program that teaches learners to recognize when someone is thinking about suicide and steps to connect them to help. SafeTALK is a 4-hour in-person training designed to ensure that people with thoughts of suicide are connected to helpers who are prepared to provide first-aid interventions.

name: TAIBU Community Health Centre
location: Provider: Community | Care Category: One-On-One Sessions
description: TAIBU Community Health Centre provides primary health care and related services for Black populations across the Greater Toronto Area as its priority population and residents of the local community of Malvern.

name: University Health Insurance Program
location: Providers: Community, Partner | Care Category: Information & Education
description: The University Health Insurance Plan (UHIP) is a mandatory health insurance plan for all international and exchange students enrolled in an Ontario university. UHIP helps to cover the cost of hospital and medical services you may need to maintain your health while in Canada.

name: UTM: Peer Support Program
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Peer to Peer Support
description: This 6-week peer support program matches lower-year UTM students with expressed mental health concerns with upper-year mentors. Six sessions are arranged to discuss goal setting, wellness, and on-campus and community resources.

name: UTSC: Peer-to-Peer Drop In
location: Provider: UTSC | Care Category: Peer to Peer Support
description: Peer-to-Peer Groups are facilitated by our trained student peer supporters and offered twice a week for students to join conversations on experiences of mental health, learn different coping strategies and resources on campus.

name: UTSG: Health & Wellness Peer Support Service
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: Peer to Peer Support
description: Chat with a trained University of Toronto student peer about whatever is on your mind, right away. Support is offered in a one-on-one, drop-in, non-judgemental, confidential and accessible virtual space.

name: Verification of Student Illness or Injury
location: Providers: UTM, UTSC, UTSG | Care Category: Specialist Care
description: This is the official University of Toronto form for all students who are requesting special academic consideration based on illness or injury.

name: Well Being Collective at Hart House
location: Provider: UTSG | Care Category: Peer to Peer Support
description: The Collective is about creating space for Indigenous, Black, and Racialized people to explore wellness from a lens that centres their particular experiences, voices, and knowledge.behaviour change coaching and exercise training to students for mental health support.

name: Wellness at Home
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Organized Workshops
description: Wellness at Home is a new online initiative featuring daily wellness workshops, activities, and resources from Mondays through Fridays.

name: Wellness Together Canada
location: Provider: Community | Care Categories: One-On-One Sessions, Guided Learning, Information & Education, Peer to Peer Support
description: Wellness Together Canada is a free mental health resource hub funded by the Government of Canada. Wellness Together Canada was created and launched in response to the unprecedented rise in mental distress due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Today, many individuals and communities across Canada are facing unique issues as a result of increased isolation, substance use, financial and employment uncertainty, community strife resulting from systemic oppression, as well as other physical and mental health concerns. In an effort to provide assistance to individuals and communities across Canada, Wellness Together Canada provides free resources that foster and support mental wellness and recovery. At Wellness Together Canada, we believe that every day presents an opportunity to take a step toward our own wellbeing. We are here to support individuals and communities on that journey. The Wellness Together Canada portal provides various resources and supports to advance mental health recovery and mental wellness. These resources include self-guided assessments and educational material, peer-to-peer support, and free one-on-one counselling with certified professionals.

name: Wellness Wednesday: Mindful Yoga
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Guided Learning
description: Join us live every Wednesday @hccutmwellness for this mindful yoga practice facilitated in partnership with the Recreation, Athletics and Wellness Centre (RAWC). Sessions will be posted on IGTV immediately afterward for on-demand access.

name: Wellness Wednesday: Wellness 101 Workshops
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Organized Workshops
description: Learn from staff and faculty on how to become your healthiest and happiest self! Featuring a unique wellness topic each week.

name: What’s Up Clinic
location: Provider: Community | Care Category: One-On-One Sessions
description: Immediate mental health counselling for children, youth, young adults and their families, and families with infants is available at the What's Up Walk-In® Clinic

name: Workshops
location: Provider: UTM | Care Category: Organized Workshops
description: Variety of workshops facilitated by the Health & Counselling Centre's counsellors and staff.
